item.title: Understanding Pod Topology Spread Constraints and Node Affinity in Kubernetes
item.description:
When you’re running applications in Kubernetes, it’s important to think about where your Pods (the units that make up your application) are placed in your cluster. Getting this right helps keep your application available, resilient, and running smoothly. Two tools that can help you do this are Pod Topology Spread Constraints and Node Affinity. Letâ€™s break these down with some easy-to-understand examples.

1. Pod Topology Spread Constraints

Think of Pod Topology Spread Constraints as a way to tell Kubernetes, “Hey, I want my Pods spread out evenly across different parts of my cluster.” This helps prevent all your Pods from ending up in the same spot, which could be a problem if that spot has an issue.
